answerText: T cell[10] This subtype of T-cells expresses CD8 on their surface and are responsible for killing virus-infected host cells. Unlike natural killer cells, they do recognize "self" and are part of the induced immune system.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 14 - Finals 2 | 21 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Sezary's syndrome occurs when these cells are loaded up with mucopolysaccharides and lodge themselves in the skin. For 10 points each: [10] Name these lymphocytes that get their name from the fact that they mature in the thymus. Their "helper" subtype is responsible for activating B cells and express CD4.
